Articles.Content:
So I've recently had this problem where I time-warp and the command pod just comes off, I lose control of it, and it infinitely accelerates. I can't time-warp again because it says that the ship is under acceleration... Another thing, I staged off a huge lifting stage, and as I watched it sail away, it exploded into a bunch of different pieces without any visual fire/explosion. It just separated. It could be a mod, maybe MechJeb or TAC Self Destruct but I'm not sure. Please help! :C

Edited June 19, 2014 by 4j25

Try removing all the mods, see if the problem persists. If not that, it could be a Kraken!(Dramatic music ensues)

Does it happen repeatedly or only sometimes?

Without pictures, etc, etc... it's hard to tell what might be happening.

Based on the fact that you said "I staged off a huge lifting stage," here is my first random guess...

Try this:

New Decoupler (TR-38-D) causes crash when staging (linux/mac) or parts of the ship to follow around (windows) Ã¢â‚¬â€œ [FIX]

When staging, the new decoupler (TR-38-D) causes a variety of problems depending on your operating system. This problem seems to be worse if struts are involved. Thanks to Kasuha, the problem was narrowed down to the physics of the decoupler and is easily fixed.

1) With a text editor (such as notepad) open up the part.cfg file for the TR-38-D. It should be located in KSP\GameData\NASAmission\Parts\Size3Decoupler\part.cfg

2) Find the line that says Ã¢â‚¬Å“PhysicsSignificance = 1Ã¢â‚¬Â and change it to Ã¢â‚¬Å“PhysicsSignificance = 0Ã¢â‚¬Â

3) Save the file and restart KSP.

If that doesn't help, come back with some well lit pictures of your craft and descriptions of what's happening when you stage and when you warp (and maybe pics of those events too). It's also possible you have some part clipping issues going on. Or maybe a claw is involved...
Ah, well, it fixed itself. XD Well, guess it's answered... (How do I give it the [Answered] tag?)
Edit your original post and click "Go Advanced." There's a dropdown, then you can save.
